page.title: 11FOREST ROW PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The Forest Row Primary School was established in 1851 and occupies two sites. The first site is for infants aged five to seven divided into three classes but as from the summer of 1986 there will be a fourth class. The second site accommodates 113 children aged seven to eleven. Two thirds of the school move onto {Sackville {Comprehensive}in East Grinstead to complete their education.The remainder either go onto {Chailey Comprehensive} or{The Beacon}in Crowborough. There are about {30}children in each class and are grouped according to age.The main subjects taught are English,Maths, History, Science, Geography,French, Music, Art and Craft.Physical Education includes football, netball, athletics and swimming, which takes place at the Kings Leisure Centre in East Grinstead
